Our European partners have finally agreed to withdraw the insistence on unprecedented and unrealistic primary surpluses. #Greece
They also reaffirmed the opening of a debate under the new agreement on Greek debt and its repayment terms.
What we have today is the obligation to start implementing a series of sweeping reforms.
Fight against tax evasion. Addressing institutional, political & criminal corruption. Reconstruction of public administration. Restart economy
We have the big fight in front of us and the really great challenge: to rebuild a rogue country and a dead people.
The first bill we will table at the beginning of next week will address measures to address the humanitarian crisis.
Specific settings will be included to provide free power & food to 300,000 households.
It will include the start-up scheme for 30,000 beneficiaries and provisions to limit the evictions.
Direct Relief of 3.7 million individuals & micro, small & medium businesses.
We file a bill to regulate the arrears to the State.
The same bill includes regulation of debts to insurance funds.
Next week, we will table legislation that will implement our commitment to protecting our first home.
Next Thursday, on March 5, we go to the #ERT
Legislative work will continue as we have to change day by day a monstrous regime of opacity & corruption.
We will radically reform the landscape of public administration in Greece, beyond corporate interests and customer engagements.
Our government has today decided to revoke the Architecture and Electromechanical Study License of the #skomries factory.
Our new government was elected to serve the interests of the workers and the Greek people with unwavering effect.

The advisory tweets now excerpts from the speech of the president during inauguration of the wind farm #Geribatu, in RS.
RT @blogplanalto: #AoVivo President @dilmabr addresses the inauguration ceremony of the # Geribatu Wind Farm. Follow: http://t.co/UHhqd...
I fought a lot for energy security, which requires people to produce the necessary energy for the growth of the country and the comfort of the population.
The guarantee is not 10 min, it is 24 hours a day, 365 days a year, rain or shine. #Geribatu
In Brazil we have a system fundamentally driven by water. When it has enough it is very good, but we can not depend only on water.
In addition to the hydroelectric plants we have to have wind farms, thermoelectric plants, ...
Diversification of the matrix + zero waste is a guarantee of the country's energy security. #Geribatu
Our part is to offer, the part of the citizen is to seek not to waste energy. #Geribatu
We have worked hard to guarantee the country's energy security. In the 4 years of my first gov, we have increased production by 21 thousand MW.
As we mark this important anniversary in Ukraine, Canada re-commits to standing firmly w / its citizens. Read more: http://t.co/p39O3vQ8Rt
In 2015, we will deliver another 6.4 thousand MW of energy and + 7 thousand km of transmission. It means we are always investing. #Geribatu
A wind farm consolidates and strengthens all regions of Brazil. It is important for RS but also for Brazil. #Geribatu
We are pioneering the issue of wind energy. Undoubtedly, the vocation of this region will allow great exploitation of wind energy.
When water is lacking in Brazil, the price of energy increases, yes, because what you did not pay you pay (other sources of energy).
The increase in energy prices is temporary, due to the fact that the country faces the greatest lack of water in recent years. #Geribatu
A wind farm like this consolidates and reinforces our choice for a clean and environmentally sustainable energy matrix. #Geribatu
Thank you to all who collaborated for a project of this magnitude. It's a pride. #Geribatu
President Dilma participated in the inauguration of the #Geribatu wind farm and the Transmission System in RS. http://t.co/fTrPS5wCJ4

The advisory tweets now excerpts from the president's speech at the inauguration of the Artilleros wind farm in Uruguay.
RT @blogplanalto: #AoVivo President @dilmabr addresses the inauguration ceremony of # ParqueEólicoArtilleros. Follow: http://t.co/tZk1J...
I am thrilled to be here when Pepe Mujica left the Uruguayan government.
Pepe is not only committed to all of Uruguay's important interests but also to Brazil and other Latin American countries.
Pepe is committed to democracy and human rights. I have the honor to be here at this special time.
From our bilateral relations, we have proven that it is possible to achieve greater approximation and integration between our countries through common actions.
This is the first investment of Eletrobras abroad, in partnership with UTE, Uruguay.
It is part of a vision of integration between Brazil and Uruguay, and is a model that we have to follow to build other countries with our integration.
It is possible, yes, integration, with both sides gaining and respecting, generating employment and absorption of technology for the two countries.
I am sure that relations between Brazil and Uruguay will be deepened with the arrival of President Tabaré.
I am committed to working shoulder to shoulder with him every day, both in our relations and in multilateral relations.
We will work to ensure that we have a Latin America of Pepe Mujica's dreams: democratic, libertarian and developed.
Dilma and Mujica, in Uruguay, where they inaugurated the #Artilleros wind farm, made in partnership between Eletrobras and UTE. http://t.co/9Tqxcpl7QF
